perturbation.original_text: This Form of Sub-Reseller Agreement (this “Sub-Reseller Agreement”) is made and entered in by and between salesforce.com, inc., a Delaware corporation having its principal place of business at The Landmark @ One Market, Suite 300, San Francisco, California 94105 (“SFDC” or “Salesforce”) and the Reseller named above and amends that certain Reseller Agreement between Salesforce and Reseller dated as of August 1, 2015, as previously amended (the “Agreement”). This Sub-Reseller Agreement is effective as of the later of the dates beneath the Parties’ signatures below (“Sub-Reseller Effective Date”), provided, however, that the dates of the Parties’ signatures are not separated by a period of time greater than ten (10) business days. If such period is greater than ten (10) business days then this Sub-Reseller Agreement shall be deemed null and void and to be of no effect.
perturbation.changed_text: This Form of Sub-Reseller Agreement (this “Sub-Reseller Agreement”) is made and entered in by and between salesforce.com, inc., a Delaware corporation having its principal place of business at The Landmark @ One Market, Suite 300, San Francisco, California 94105 (“SFDC” or “Salesforce”) and the Vendor named above and amends that certain Reseller Agreement between Salesforce and Reseller dated as of August 1, 2015, as previously amended (the “Agreement”). This Sub-Reseller Agreement is effective as of the later of the dates beneath the Parties’ signatures below (“Sub-Reseller Effective Date”), provided, however, that the dates of the Parties’ signatures are not separated by a period of time greater than ten (10) business days. If such period is greater than ten (10) business days then this Sub-Reseller Agreement shall be deemed null and void and to be of no effect.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Reseller' is replaced with 'Vendor'. While 'Reseller' is defined later in the document via reference to the 'Agreement', 'Vendor' is not defined anywhere, leading to potential confusion about the roles and responsibilities, particularly as other sections still refer to 'Reseller'.

perturbation.original_text: Resale Rights. SFDC hereby appoints SUB-RESELLER (“Sub-Reseller”) as a sub-reseller to whom Reseller may resell Services in accordance with Section 2(ii) of the Agreement, provided that Sub-Reseller may only resell such Services to Customer. Reseller must ensure that Sub-Reseller complies with the terms of the Agreement applicable to Reseller as if Sub-Reseller were an original party to the Agreement and any breach by Sub-Reseller of the Agreement will be deemed a breach by Reseller.
perturbation.changed_text: Resale Rights. SFDC hereby appoints SUB-RESELLER (“Sub-Reseller”) as a sub-reseller to whom Vendor may resell Services in accordance with Section 2(ii) of the Agreement, provided that Sub-Reseller may only resell such Services to Consumer. Vendor must ensure that Sub-Reseller complies with the terms of the Agreement applicable to Reseller as if Sub-Reseller were an original party to the Agreement and any breach by Sub-Reseller of the Agreement will be deemed a breach by Reseller.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Reseller' is replaced with 'Vendor,' consistent with the first perturbation. Also, 'Customer' is replaced with 'Consumer'. Since 'Vendor' isn't defined, it's now unclear if 'Reseller' and 'Vendor' have the same obligations, and the introduction of 'Consumer' when all other references are to 'Customer' adds to the ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text: Reseller must ensure that Sub-Reseller complies with the terms of the Agreement applicable to Reseller as if Sub- Reseller were an original party to the Agreement and any breach by Sub-Reseller of the Agreement will be deemed a breach by Reseller. Sub-Reseller is not be a third-party beneficiary of the Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Reseller must ensure that Sub-Reseller complies with the terms of the Agreement applicable to Vendor as if Sub- Reseller were an original party to the Agreement and any breach by Sub-Reseller of the Agreement will be deemed a breach by Sub-Distributor. Sub-Reseller is not be a third-party beneficiary of the Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This section changes 'Reseller' to 'Vendor' and 'Reseller' to 'Sub-Distributor' after previously establishing the parties as 'Sub-Reseller'. This is unclear for the reader as it breaks the internal logic of who is responsible in the case of a breach of agreement.
